sourceMeaningMnemonic: When everyone has <radical>grain</radical> in their <radical>mouth</radical>, you will have <kanji>peace</kanji>. That is the <kanji>Japanese style</kanji> of doing things.
meaningInfo: Imagine Japanese people with grain in their mouth. The whole country is at peace.
readingMnemonic: <kanji>Peace</kanji> is the <kanji>Japanese style</kanji>. The <reading>wa</reading>lruses (<ja>わ</ja>) living off of Japan see this, and start to emulate.
readingInfo: The walruses also achieve peace by putting grain in every walrus' mouth, following the Japanese style.
